Live from NPR News in Washington I'm Laurie London hurricane Michael is closing in on the Florida Panhandle as a dangerous and life threatening storm
NPR's Debbie Elliott reports Michael has strengthened to a category for hurricane with one hundred and fifty miles per hour winds
Michael is making history as the strongest hurricane to hit the northern Gulf Coast Florida governor Rick Scott says expect unimaginable devastation
Hurricane Michael is forecast to be the most destructive storm to hit the Florida Panhandle in a century
FEMA director Brock Long calls it the worst kind of hurricane combining damaging winds heavy rain and the storm surge that could reach fourteen feet
Those who stick around through experience storm surge do typically lived to tell about it unfortunately
As it moves inland hurricane Michael is also going to impact parts of southeast Alabama Georgia and the Carolinas Debbie Elliott NPR News quest view Florida

Where the cabinet on the court abortion rights opponents see a new opportunity to weaken or overturn roe the Nineteen Seventy three decision that legalized abortion nationwide Planned Parenthood's Don McGahn says abortion rights advocates expected increasingly difficult environment

Anew United Nations report finds an exceptionally high number of civilian casualties in Afghanistan as Jennifer glass reports from Kabul the report says what's particularly worrisome is the targeting of ethnic and religious minorities
He tells me that the Afghans have been killed or injured and the first nine months of this year says the UN's quarterly report on civilian casualties
Combined use of suicide in non suicide improvised explosive devices cause the most casualties fellow by ground engagements been targeted killings casualties caused by airstrikes or to an all time high up thirty nine percent over last year
The majority of the casualties sixty five percent are caused by anti government groups such as the Taliban and Islamic state
African security forces are responsible for sixteen percent fighting between the group's accounts for ten percent international forces are responsible for five percent with the rent unable to be determined
Election related violence has killed or injured three hundred and sixty six people of particular concern with parliamentary elections ten days away for NPR News I'm Jennifer glass in Kabul

The Justice Department is charging an alleged Chinese spy with economic espionage and theft of trade secrets is NPR's Ryan Lucas explains a suspected Chinese intelligence operative was extradited from Belgium to the west to face charges
Young judge who was arrested in Belgium in April and extradited to the U.S this week he faces four counts including conspiracy to commit economic espionage and steal trade secrets
Shoe has now made his initial appearance at federal court in Cincinnati, Ohio court papers said that she works for China's ministry of state security he allegedly targeted a range of aviation aerospace companies including GE Aviation
Shoe invited experts in engineers to China under the guise of making university presentations but in fact prosecutors say the trips are part of an effort to steal sensitive proprietary information
